summary: As of December 2018, the UN had 14 ongoing peacekeeping operations involving about 103,000 personnel. The U.S. is the single largest financial contributor to these operations. Our review of Department of State assessments and discussions with State officials found that UN operations generally do not fully meet U.S. principles for effective peacekeeping, such as obtaining host country consent. State officials also said they need better...
title: UN Peacekeeping Operations: State Should Take Additional Steps to Work with the UN to Improve Effectiveness and Performance Information
